graph_title: Percentage households that experienced food insecurity in bristol
indicator_name: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population, based on the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES)
target_name: By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round
indicator_available: Proportion of households that suffered from food insecurity
indicator_description: Percentage of households reporting that they suffered from moderate to severe or severe food insecurity
computation_definitions: The number of respondents who select/tick "yes" to at least 4 (4 is moderate to severe, those who select 7 or more are also recognised as severe) of the FIES questions(Q18151 to Q18157 inclusive) divided by the number of respondents who select/tick "yes" or "no" to the eight FIES questions
computation_calculations: No calculations were performed in the data acquisition of this indicator as appropriate data was readily available in the final format specified by this indicator.
source_other_info_1: Data acquired from the Quality of life survey
